source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Solanaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Solanaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves variously hairy, margins more or less recurved, mostly less than 25 mm long, mostly less than 8 mm wide; calyx hairy; corolla-lobes spreading to less than 1 cm diam
Leaves glabrous or nearly so, flat, mostly 25–75 mm long, 8–20 mm wide; calyx glabrous; corolla-lobes spreading to more than 1 cm diam.; Grampians, Mt Arapiles and Dargo area

Branches with an indumentum of whitish stellate hairs and glandular hairs; leaves mostly 6–15 mm long; flowers in clusters of 2–3; corolla-lobes lanceolate, acute, longer than tube; upper Snowy River area

Branches with an indumentum of short glandular and non-glandular hairs; leaves mostly 2–10 mm long; flowers usually solitary; corolla-lobes ovate, more or less obtuse, about as long as tube; Grampians and north-west Victoria
